summary: This collection presents a deep dive into how the principles of ecosystem architecture can influence various fields. Featuring a comprehensive article on the merging of decentralization and regenerative design, and a profile on Jan Hein Hoogstad focused on design, technology, and user experience, it highlights the interdisciplinary nature of modern networked ecosystems.
excerpt: Ecosystem architecture merges decentralization with regenerative design, leveraging diverse fields to build and sustain healthy, distributed networks and communities.
